body:
**Example**

If your sentence ended on 17 September 2018, it would expire on 17 March 2019.

You would not need to tell people about the conviction after 17 March 2019.

**About the expiry date**

The expiry date of your conviction is based on:

* what you told us about your conviction 
* the current law on when convictions expire

This table shows you what you told us. If any of this information is wrong, the expiry date we've given you might also be wrong.

 | | |
|---|---|
| Criminal record type | **Conviction**|
| Type of conviction | **Community** |
| Name of conviction | **Curfew** |
| Age at time of caution | **Under 18** |
| Date conviction given | **Not known**|

___

components.html:
If you need to change any information, or if you have another caution or conviction youâ€™d like to check, [use the service again](/).

**[Print this page](/)**

heading: Your conviction will expire 6 months after the sentence ends
lede: As soon as the conviction expires you will not need to tell anyone about it unless an [exception applies](https://www.gov.uk/exoffenders-and-employment?#when-employers-still-need-to-know-about-your-conviction).
